Its pretty fun if you don't take the game too seriously. It has a pretty steep learning curve but is a lot of fun once you get into it. Overall the game can be pretty expensive unless you purchase most of the DLC through cdkeys or G2A. Cosmetics are also very very expensive but can technically be earned through just playing the game a lot. 

Pros:
- Very fun with friends or casually
- You get to play some of your favorite horror icons.
- Steep learning curve. Meaning you will always be learning something new.
- Active updates. ~ 1 1/2 months inbetween updates.

Cons:
- Pretty expensive to unlock all of the content.
- A good amount of toxic and entitled players.
- Developers don't really listen to their community. Takes a really long time to fix bugs and buff/nerf killers. As an example, they fixed The Blight's POV but failed to fix his collision that make his ability very frustrating to use on some maps.

Игра, которая пустит по п***е ваши нервы. Пупырышные мурашки по колготкам? Пожалуйста! Сломать другу пару костей, пока лечишь его? Могу, умею, практикую. Починить 4 генератора, снимать всех с крюков, отвлекать убийцу, добыть из ящиков ультраредкие предметы и не успеть сбежать в открытые ворота или люк, потому что пошёл помогать тормознутому тиммейту? Хоспаде, так это же про меня! 

Игра, в целом, не на один вечер. Завораживающая атмосфера, узнаваемые локации, леденящий кровь саундтрек, разнообразные маньячилы, которые спят и видят, как бы распотрошить тебя - вам обязательно понравится DbD :) 

С друзьями, конечно, играть веселее. Так что, собирайте компанию и заваливайтесь в дискорд.

Fun game to play with your friends.

To be honest this game is great but behavior cares more about pushing out new dlc every few months instead of actually making the core gameplay balanced and fun. Dont get me wrong ive had lots of fun times on this game, and im sure theres more to be had as well. BUT, I find myself having less and less fun with this game the more I play it. I see no reason to keep playing this game when i have to keep dumping money into it to get one new meta perk while the rest are lost in a sea of saturated garbage. 

Although after saying all this ill probably still end up coming back to this game. As you can see from most reviews, its a love hate relationship with this game for most people who play it.

[h1] Best Game Ever, but Toxic Community!!! (TLDR included) [/h1]

Hello there! After successfully achieving 69 hours in this game, I thought I'd post a review on this game. This game is absolutely fantastic! One thing to note though, the community is probably the most hateful and toxic group of people I have ever met in my entire life, and that's not an understatement. Go to half of the reviews on this game and they'll tell you the same thing.

If you plan on buying this game, just know that you WILL get hate no matter what you do. If you're new, people disconnect. If you're playing killer, some people who get downed will immediately disconnect, and most of the time, after you complete a match, ANYONE will spam you on how you are garbage at the game. I've even heard stories of people receiving messages or party invites on the console version of this game JUST to tell them how bad they are at the game or harshly criticize their gameplay style. It's ridiculous how salty people get in this game, and I wish I was exaggerating.

There's also a ranking system which seems kinda pointless, considering you get people who have a thousand hours in it no matter what. It especially doesn't help that there are only 20 ranks, but hey, at least they get reset every 13th of every month, right? I get that it tries to match newbies with other newbies, but tbh, it doesn't even remotely work. If they wanted to do that, maybe they should go off of your stats of how many games you've won or completed? Idk, just a suggestion.

TLDR: Good game, bad matchmaking, turn off chat forever, and do whatever you want as the killer. It's funnier that way, knowing you're making the salt rain :)

A really fun and try hard game to play...Especially at night..I d like the game more if it was not that much of a "pay to win".Because lots of characters are locked and they are only unlocked if you buy them with real money(there are also some characters that can be also bought with in game coins,but that's only a few one but "whew" at least they have a (weekly or monthly ) shop that you can buy with some IN game money (not much) some perks that might the other characters have instead of buying them normally(the characters)...Except that It's a game that everyone SHOULD have...Because c'mon how many games are out there that are SO innovative, not only for the part of hide 'n seek "thing" but from all the concept of being a killer and having abilities...The machines that must be fixed from the survivors and all that good stuff...100% recommended to everyone and ofc you can't get bored If you're having a big group.Not mentioned that you can't get bored easily not only because your fellows are playing the game with ya, but because the game itself is so addictive to play and you keep wanting to get better and upgrade and upgrade..Aand one last importand factor is that It can be played with so many different playstyles (because of the perks etc..)So as I said the basic cons are: (more specific)

Cons: 
-You have to pay a bit more if you want a better game experience..
-(NOT MENTIONED) I would like the game to be a bit more dark so it would be scarier :)

Pros: 
-Not boring(You can upgrade all the characters and then prestige them)
-A lot of things to do(challenges,upgrades,perks)
-Scary sometimes
-Knowledge and skills wins most of the times(So you must have some good perks and upgrades and that happens from your own decision on how you desire to play so you can win easier)=>>skills=>>knowledge
